text:
Anyone know how to fix this?

```
{
  correlationId: "db3a660d-5d18-417f-97bd-f032ea2bb676"
  message: "Invalid UTF-8 start byte 0xf9↵ at [Source: java.io.SequenceInputStream@18302afa; line: 1, column: 22146]"
  requestId: "85492b7cd2affd886e25c3a783babbc8"
  status: "error"
}
```

anyway, if i copy/paste the code into the DM, no issue at all…

Update: here the post on the community: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Issue-with-Template-API/m-p/267529>
Hi, Can I find the users owner id from the vid?
By api
What API endpoint are you hitting?
<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/contact/vid/3234574/profile?hapikey=demo>
The result does not have some ownerid
What operating system are you using?
MacOS
have you tried `Property` parameter?
Can you check the encoding of the problematic file by running `file -I <fileName>`
Here u go
how?
you don't need to have this parameter too, if you contact have `owner` you will get that in -- `HubSpot_owner_id` field
you are hitting correct endpoint, just make sure that your contact have, owner assigned.
Can you try `grep -axv '.*' <fileName>`
Should search the file for any invalid utf-8 characters
Thank you, I have solved it

<@U22VBL87M> Maybe you have some thoughts on this? He is using node.js to push template updates, however I think the issue is coming from strings being utf-16 in JS vs. our endpoints which accept utf-8

Hi, I need to help a client in modifying the default HubSpot search module to search the HubSpot portal rather than by domain.  They currently have their entire site hosted on HubSpot with their primary domain, <https://www.apspayments.com> and a subdomain <http://creditcardprocessing.apspayments.com|creditcardprocessing.apspayments.com>. They are using the default HubSpot search module.  The default HubSpot search module only returns search for one domain, thus if you perform search on <http://www.apspayments.com|www.apspayments.com> it will only return pages on that domain.  The client wants the search to return pages located on both <http://www.apspayments.com|www.apspayments.com> and <http://creditcardprocessing.apspayments.com|creditcardprocessing.apspayments.com>.  HubSpot says "As mentioned initially currently our defaults only searches one domain at the time and changing this would require a custom API configuration which can be changed via a custom endpoint, <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content)> " I am not a developer, is it possible to walk me through how to do this for my client?
Do you want to search the entire portal or just two domains?
Hi Matt, yes the entire portal only consists of the two domains so I believe my answer is yes. I don't think there would be any reason not to.
So what you will want to do is clone the search bar
You can add a hidden input to the search input like so `<input type="hidden" name="domain" value="<http://creditcardprocessing.apspayments.com|creditcardprocessing.apspayments.com>">`
There is a comment in the HTML for where you should put it
<#C2YHAHB6K|api> Matt thank you I will give it a try! :slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks for the help <@UCH1L597V> :raised_hands::pray:
I don't see a comment area
That is the results
You should look at the `search input` module
Which is the actual search bar
Yea that looks right
Awesome you are amazing!!!

it isn't returning the value for both domains what am I doing wrong? here is the link of the search return <https://www.apspayments.com/hs-search-results?term=Sage+100cloud&domain=creditcardprocessing.apspayments.com&domain=apspayments.com&offset=30>
Always welcome <@UEBFFEJ4E> <@U22PKFRU5>
Guys can you help me on this. Im implementing report API for my page. I got error in my callback page to Request for Integration Permissions. Is there any setting needed to setup in admin or API.
